title: Pasta Bolognese
ingredients: 1 Large onion or 2 small, cut into 1-inch dice
Extra Virgin olive oil for the pan
1 bunch thyme tied into a bundle

Instructions:  In a food processor, puree onion, carrots, celery and garlic into a course paste.   In a large pan over medium heat, coat pan with oil.   Add the pureed vegetables and season generously with salt.   Bring the pan to medium high heat and cook until all of the water has evaporated, and they become nice and brown, stirring frequently about 15 to 20 minutes.
Add the ground beef and pork.  Season again generously with salt.  Cook approximately another 15 to 20 minutes.
Add the tomato paste and cook until brown about 4 to 5 minutes.  Add the red wine and scrap any brown bits off the bottom.  Cook until the wine has reduced by half.

Add water to the pan until the water is about 1 inch above the meat.  Toss in the bay leaves and the bundle of thyme and stir to combine everything.   Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer.  As water evaporates gradually add more (2 to 3 cups at a time).  Don’t be shy about adding more water during cooking process as it can be cooked out.  Stir and taste frequently.  Season as needed.   Simmer for 3 ½ to 4 hours.
During the final 30 minutes of cooking bring a large pot of salted water to boil over high heat to cook the spaghetti.
Source: Original source Anne Burrell Food Network TV.  Minor updates by Erick Perales
